content:
Over quota means your account is full with your mail provider. You might need to go into webmail using a web browser and actually delete some stuff and empty the trash to free up some space, or if your provider offers the option you might be able to buy or rent more space so you do not have to delete anything.

Regardless this is an issue with your mail provider refusing to allow you to get mail until you have free space on their mail server to hold it.

content: Hi David . Thank you for the information about that program . I am pushing the hell out of eighty and getting one program to work with a another program is above my pay grade and having dyslexia doesn't help . Robert
creator: Warhawk

content: I suggest you try it. There is no software interface to hook up; you just talk and it converts to text. A disabled woman in early 80s needed voice to text and I installed for her and she just starts Dragon software, starts thunderbird, clicks the 'new message' button and starts talking. For her, I located a new copy Version 13 (but several years old) on ebay and she's very happy. I just checked and prices go from $30 on up. I suggest buying an unopened one, and I think they come with microphones, but possibly not needed with newer PCs that have them built in. As a tip, her only problem was to click the voice-to-text feature OFF when not dictating, as Dragon keeps on typing... :)

content: If a gmail POP account is on multiple computers, you must enable 'recent mode' to access all messages. It's explained in the first section here.

content:
Hi David,

The error message for the desktop application is:

An error occurred during a connection to live.thunderbird.net.

  • The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.
  • If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer's network connection.
  • If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Thunderbird is permitted to access the web.

The internet is working for my laptop browser and all of our TV streaming channels. I am getting messages on my phone via Thunderbird. I have turned off our virus software and uninstalled the VPN for the time being - still nothing on the Thunderbird desktop.

Thanks for responding.
